CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 25, 1957, pg. A3, reads: "Pat Corr's Plan - This advertisement in 16th District of the Fifth Ward polling place (similar to others in the Hill District) was part of Pat Corr's bid to win nomination for Judge of Common Pleas Court Tuesday. Placing this display card beside that of the regular Democratic ticket, indicated his support of all endorsed candidates except the judges.  In spite of this and help from employers of Prothonotary David B. Roberts office, latest unofficial returns show the strategy failed, and Mr. Corr trailed the six incumbent judges. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Brick building and fence with signs for Democratic ticket, including David L. Lawrence for mayor, Patrick Corr for Judge, Aloysius T. "Ish" McLaughlin for Sheriff, Joseph McArdle for Mayor, and Louis C. Glasso for Judge
